pr_title: Allow Loot Tracker to track Herbiboar loot with an Open Herb Sack

timeline.body:
Since this is specific to the herbiboar, this should be named as such.
```suggestion
	private boolean processHerbiboarHerbSackLoot(int timestamp, String event, LootRecordType lootRecordType)
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Since this is specific to the herbiboar, this should be named as such.

Suggested change
private boolean processHerbSackLoot(int timestamp, String event, LootRecordType lootRecordType)
private boolean processHerbiboarHerbSackLoot(int timestamp, String event, LootRecordType lootRecordType)
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.bodyHTML:
This would be cleaner as a guard clause.

Suggested change
if (messageNode.getTimestamp() == timestamp && messageNode.getType() == ChatMessageType.SPAM)
if (messageNode.getTimestamp() != timestamp || messageNode.getType() != ChatMessageType.SPAM)
{
continue;
}
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.body:
As I understand from the code below, there are two possible chat messages which can appear:

* You put the Grimy Guam leaf herb into your herb sack.
* Your herb sack is too full to hold the Grimy Guam leaf herb.

Wouldn't a pattern matching `.+(Grimy .+) herb.+` match the herb name fully without any of the extra logic below? Also, the pattern matching/replacing should be replaced with a compiled `Pattern` object and a matcher on the messageNode string.
timeline.bodyText:
As I understand from the code below, there are two possible chat messages which can appear:

You put the Grimy Guam leaf herb into your herb sack.
Your herb sack is too full to hold the Grimy Guam leaf herb.

Wouldn't a pattern matching .+(Grimy .+) herb.+ match the herb name fully without any of the extra logic below? Also, the pattern matching/replacing should be replaced with a compiled Pattern object and a matcher on the messageNode string.
timeline.bodyHTML:
As I understand from the code below, there are two possible chat messages which can appear:

  • You put the Grimy Guam leaf herb into your herb sack.
  • Your herb sack is too full to hold the Grimy Guam leaf herb.

Wouldn't a pattern matching .+(Grimy .+) herb.+ match the herb name fully without any of the extra logic below? Also, the pattern matching/replacing should be replaced with a compiled Pattern object and a matcher on the messageNode string.
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

replies.bodyText:
There is also another message when you manually add a herb to your sack which is:

You add the Grimy Guam leaf to your sack.

But I don't think its possible to manually add herbs in the same timestamp as harvesting Herbiboar.
replies.author: deon9718

timeline.bodyHTML:
Since the if branch returns from this method, the rest of this code does not need to be in an else block. That is, this should be replaced by the following:

if (herbs.isEmpty())
{
	return false;
}

addLoot(event, -1, lootRecordType, herbs);
return true;
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.message: apply more suggestions from code review

loottracker: Track herbiboar loot with an open herb sack

When looting the herbiboar with an open herb sack, instead of receiving
the herbs to your inventory, the herbs are deposited to the sack
directly and the player receives chat messages indicating the herbs they
received. This commit adds support for reading those chat messages when
looting the herbiboar.

This change incidentally fixes an issue which arose when the open herb
sack was introduced to the game where any inventory change after looting
the herbiboar would be tracked as herbiboar loot, such as drinking a
stamina potion.

Closes runelite/runelite#10655
Fixes runelite/runelite#10718

timeline.body: I've made `IterableHashTable` generic now to make this less terrifying
timeline.bodyText: I've made IterableHashTable generic now to make this less terrifying
timeline.bodyHTML: I've made IterableHashTable generic now to make this less terrifying
